Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Dwaltch
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two teenagers at Miapera in March 2012 and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is situated the Taksim/Beyoglu area so there is vibrant nightlife all around, while the hotel itself was on a very quiet street. We enjoyed the location because, unlike Sultanahmet, it was filled with locals and not simply a tourist area. The rooms were very comfortable, the staff accommodating, the breakfast buffet was outstanding. The hotel also has a small pool/hottub and sauna, which were a welcome respite at the end of each day. Obviously, Miapera is not a large chain hotel which are certainly plentiful in Istanbul, but this was an excellent value in comparison. I would definitely go back and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “MIAPERA...NOT SURE”
Reviews.Author: Amoras
Reviews.Content: At the first view, this hotel is charming and warm. It Is in a small street a block BEHIND THE GREAT & BUSY WALKROAD OF ISTINKLAL (10 walk to TAKSIM SQR). Most of the rooms are quite small but comfortable and have nice bathrooms with large Duch. Duble bed is small and wardrobe is quite small. Breakfast can be good (BASIC). Hotel's areas are clean and the staff are polite. We must emphasize that the neighbor where the hotel is situated is full of bars and clubs. Our room was at the frontafe side and there was excessive noise on Friday and Saturday night until early morning hours. We mean the noise of the music & drunk people OUT OF THE BAR. So it is best to book a room resembling backyard IN (FOR THE BRITISH COUNCULATE). DO NOT MISS the city map or a guide of Istanbul as most of the taxi drivers do not know all the small hotels (AS Miapera) and can be found in a circular driving trip! Unfortunately we wouldn't choose Miapera Hotel for the next visit to the beautiful Istanbul, we stayed in prettier hotel value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drea12345
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel in Beyoglu (a few steps away from the main shopping street (Istiklal) and near Taksim) is extremely conveniently located in Beyoglu. Its rooms are nicely modern, spacious, clean, and surprisingly quite. The breakfast buffet offers a broad variety of Turkish and international food and is quite tasty. We found this hotel a very good choice because the more traditional parts of Istanbul with the well-known sightseeing spots can be easily reached by public transport or are even within walking distance (e.g., Galata tower (about 15 minutes walk)), while the nicer restaurants and bars are in Beyoglu so that you have a wide variety of choices for evening dinner within walking distance from the hotel. You can also easily walk from the hotel to cross Galata bridge to Sultanahmed (e.g., to visit the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace). This is naturally a somewhat more lengthy walk but is easily manageable unless you have a walking disability in which case you can use public transport. We would always recommend to stay in the more "European" influenced Beyoglu and to visit the historical sites from there. Beyoglu admittedly does not feel and look too "oriental" but is rather comparable to cities like Barcelona, Madrid, and the like. However, in particular female travellers will feel more welcome there than in some other parts of the city where a more conservative populace (in particular males) sometimes finds its alright to make inappropriate and even aggressive remarks even if you are completely decently dressed and not behaving offensively in any way (But: You still need not be afraid in these parts and we never experienced any violence, however, one still feels somewhat uncomfortable in the very conservative parts of the city and would not wish to be confronted with behavior reflecting a somewhat backward idea of a woman's "appropriate" position in society when seeking to have a pleasant dinner somewhere (including, perhaps, with alcoholic beverages). In addition, the nicer restaurants, bars, winebars etc. will be found in the modern parts of Istanbul where two women walking around and dining alone will not encounter any problems or peculiar remarks/stares etc.; here, Istanbul is truly a very modern and pleasant European city!). All in all, Miapera hotel is an ideal choice for a visit to Istanbul and good value for money. The only (slight) critical remark concerns the English language abilities of the reception personnel. They do speak and understand some English and a visitor will ultimately be able to communicate with them, however, some brush-up language courses would do no harm and would alleviate communication in case of more complex requests. The rooftop bar seems to be open only in fair weather conditions (probably only in summer) and you should inquire before booking in case that is important for you (we did not try the spa area). They have a small conference room and business area, however, the publicly accessible computer is very slow and the printer did not work when we visited (so bring your own computer(iPad if you need a reliable connection).

Reviews.Title: “modern & clean”
Reviews.Author: c_djLondon
Reviews.Content: its a nice modern little boutique hotel situated bang in the heart of beyoglu. the down side is the small double, which was uncomfortable to share with a friend. he spa (swimming pool & jacuzzi)w were not open for the whole duration of 3 nights we stayed there. lots of miss communication and understanding with the staffs. breakfast buffet was ok, not much choice in terms of fruit (they only serve oranges).

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location...”
Reviews.Author: CavemanRacer
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly on business. The location is perfect for tourism (being close to Taksim Square) and transport links are close at hand. During the winter I've been able to negotiate great rates, but I'm not sure if once the season begins to warm up, I'll be able to continue to stay here as it will be outside my daily rate...this will be a great shame as I enjoy the hotel. The rooms are relatively small but stylishly appointed, the shower is big and powerful and the internet connection has worked without problem on every visit. Breakfast buffet is very good quality with a nice mix of international and local dishes, my only complaint being that they need to get themselves a proper Italian coffee machine (and a barista)...cappuccinos, lattes and espressos at breakfast are a necessity! The pool and sauna are a great extra bonus, especially after a long day of meetings and the stress of traveling round such a busy and vibrant city. I love Istanbul and this hotel is one of the hidden bargains.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: assamrik
Reviews.Content: Thru online booking you will get good value with reasonable price. Location good, few steps from Taksim square and close to nightlife spots.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but didn't feel like 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sat Feb 11 to Feb 18, just got back yesterday. Advice: look at your room and if it doesn't have a desk, ask for one that does. Pros: great location, great breakfast buffet, chic decor/design, excellent showers. The pool was ok, but the sauna looked great, regret not using it. With most of the complaints below, the staff was usually pretty good about working out a fix when possible. Cons: We had to change rooms after 2 nights because we had no internet signal and then our phone line died in the first room. In our second room, there was a periodic faint smell of sewage that came from the bathroom sink. It was faint enough that we didn't complain, but, still kinda gross. DO NOT STAY IN 309! It had no desk and a deeply retarded floor plan. Also, be sure to specify to the desk that you do not want any cleaning agent/deoderizer sprayed on your bed/linens. They sprayed something on our blankets that smelled utterly repulsive. Some kind of cheap, awful air-freshener-type thing. Really brutal on the nose, totally disgusting. In both rooms the mattresses were crap. I'm not a whiner, but the mattresses may have been the worst I've dealt with in a respectable hotel. We were able to sleep but woke up feeling stiff, and we did not sleep well. Also, in the new room the hair-dryer below the sink had been sitting in a puddle of water that had pooled from a leaky pipe, probably. Not acceptable for a 4-star hotel. Maid forgot to bring toilet paper one night so we had to ask for it, and because of language issues they brought us water instead of toilet paper, which was actually kind of funny. Both rooms had a total of 4 hangers in the closet. We asked for more and they brought them. Then again Â£345 total for 7 nights in a hotel including a tasty, free breakfast seems like a pretty good deal. The staff means well but should not be relied on for tourist info. One of the desk guys told us the wrong ferry terminal to go to for trip across the strait, wound up having to walk a lot farther so were late for tour of Florence Nightingale Museum. Generally not great English.

Reviews.Title: “mia pera”
Reviews.Author: luvmejollies
Reviews.Content: The room in this hotel is the only room I have ever been in where it is better in person that on the official hotel photographs. It was bigger and nicer. Shower was fab, pillows fantastic. Only thing to pick was the tv, which could have been a bit bigger, but that is being picky. We were next to the lift and there was no noise. Breakfast was good enough and staff were attentive. Large sauna and pool worth a visit to wind down after walking all day- you will need your towel from your room. The roof top terrace was closed but a member of staff opened it for me to let me take photographs of the city- well worth asking for. Location is good - just off the main shopping street - be warned don't expect to walk in straight line in this street. There are literally thousands of people walking here all day and all night till early hours. One tip- when heading out , turn left outside hotel and continue on through side walkway, don't turn right to go to the main shopping street. There is a lovely row of traditional stalls/ shops here selling a variety of food. There is another row of shops running parallel in an old indoor building selling antiques etc Lovely change from the high street stores. One warning - there is a building work on a building opposite . the work starts at 8am and goes on till late . We walked past several times at 12pm and they were still there but no loud noise. But don't let this put you off staying here unless you are a really light sleeper or just take ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not a cheap hotel for all they offer”
Reviews.Author: Elif Y
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Miapera Hotel this weekend. At our arrival the receptionist said that their room key card machine was broken and they will provide us a personnel for entering the room every time we arrived. They gave us our room card the next morning, but it's not a good impression for a start. After the belboy settled us in our room (room no:304) we've got a phone call from reception that the belboy gave us the wrong room and he's coming to change our room. We repacked our stuff and waited for him to change our room for about 5 min. After that we've got another call from reception that they've changed their mind, let us stay in the same room. After a long trip to hotel it was a real exhausted experience. Even all those bad experience, the hotel is architecturally good and well furnished, but the management is so weak to keep maintain it. Breakfast is overall well, except the expiry time of it is on 10:30 am, the personnel starts the pick and clean the buffet immediately, not even let us to take another cup of tea although we've still having our breakfast. The location of the hotel is one of the best around Taksim. You can easily reach everywhere near Taksim with a short walk. Generally the price is very high for this hotel. You may not want to pay that much just for the location. Probably we won't stay in Miapera again.

Reviews.Title: “Miapera hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vicki K
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at Mira Pera hotel, before and after Greek cruise. Well located in Pera district. Walking distance to outdoor mall and many restaurants and local people. Very safe to walk at night. Hotels modern and king bed was firm. Bathroom had nice walk in shower, just not much storage space. Friendly helpful staff, and nice free breakfast. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ReikoRing
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the manager at the front desk was kind of rude. We checked in at 5pm and our key card wasn't ready because the machine had broken down. When we went back to check on our cards later Mehmet, the manager, was a bit rude to us again. When we checked a seccond time there was another man on duity and he was nice and helpful - our cards were ready. All the other staff were friendly and helpful. Mehmet was nice to us on our last day so he could have just been in a bad mood. The pool and spa were very nice and clean. I was surprised to find that the jacuzzi was not hot, but the sauna was nice. They had a massage room that was cool too. They were even equipped with a pilates facility. The room was so nice. There was plenty of room and the had nice complimentary amenities. The design of the bathroom was amazing and everything was comfortably modern. There was a problem with the wifi reception because our room was right next to the British embassy - because of security they had a signal disrupter set up. The front desk told us that it would just be for one night but the signal in 310 was poor the next day aswell. They offered to send up a cord we could connect to our computer but we only had an iPad so we ended up sitting by the door to use the internet. The have a great view from the bar at on the roof. There was some Turkish celebrities shooting a video segment for the news when we checked it out. The bar was closed for the winter though. Mia Pera is right next to taxsim - a huge pedestrian walkway filled with shops, restaurants and people. We were able to walk to Galata Tower in about 15 mins at a slow relaxed pace. Taxsim square was also about the same distance. The complimentary breakfast was also real good. This is a great place for couples to retreat. It's not really a family oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: varunsdua
Reviews.Content: Dont go by any hotels' website telling that they are right next to istiklal street or taksim square. This hotel is exactly 50 meters away from an end of Istiklal street and then you just travel through Istiklal watich the hustle bustle and reach Taksim square in 10 mins (Although I dont know what is there to do?) But yes, this hotel's location is the best point. Rooms are small but clean. They have a small gym with a cycle and a treadmill too. They serve eggs as you like in breakfast although the buffet is small. Nothing is free in the mini bar , not even a bottle of water so you can just go out of the hotel and bring your own bottle in .5 lira which will otherwise be charged at 4 lira. Domino's pizza is opp to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: calitraveler1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in fall 2010 as part of our honeymoon. It was great! It felt like the W Hotel (ultra modern design and decor), without the W prices. It's on the newer side of Istanbul, so walking distance to a lot of great restaurants and bars. The breakfast was outstanding and included premium items. The concierge was very helpful in setting dinner reservations for us and suggesting things to do. The rooms were spacious. We just loved the look and feel of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good times with good friends”
Reviews.Author: TheRodders
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with friends in the heat of summer and was very pleasantly surprised with the quality of design and space in the hotel. The entrance lobby has a very nice feel about it and the staff were very welcoming and informed of the local area. The roms were compact but very nicely laid out with design touches everywhere. The rooftop bar offers amazing views over the city and is is a nice contemporary place to watch the sunset. Breakfast is your typical self service buffet, but is very presentable with all the food and pastries fresh and well presented. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Liz_Nogueira
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was really nice: right next door to a passage to Istiklal street. This means the location is great, but you actually don't get any noise from Istiklal. When booking, we requested a room with good sleep quality and got a Deluxe Double Room facing the British Consulate gardens on the 4th floor. The room was huge, the bathroom was just like the website's and it was indeed very quiet in the evening. Pay attention to this, since nightlife is intense in the region and the hotel has a rooftop bar! Staff is friendly and helpful but they are a bit "lost" at breakfast time, when it was hard to order even a spoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in nice area but...”
Reviews.Author: JaimeDomingo
Reviews.Content: There's a disco in the terrace!!! Nice hotel, but music is soooo loud specially for room in the 7th and 8th floors. If you ask about that to reception staff their answer in ver bad English is: "the party has no hour to finish". If you are looking for a hotel to rest never choose that one. Very noisy

Reviews.Title: “A bit of fresh air in historic Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: We started our trip in a historic hotel in Sultanahmet and ended at the Miapera in Beyoglu. There is endless discussion on where to stay in Istanbul, but I must say we enjoyed this hotel and surroundings much more. Miapera has been open for 2 years and everything shines new. The staff is helpful and attentive, beds are comfy, and contrary to some reviews we found the AC to work properly. And the bathroom was SO nice, with a wide walk in power shower! Breakfast was quite good with cooked to order options (though it was the only place in Turkey without honey). You are 1 block away from the mid point of the main pedestrian street (Istikkal), and yet this is a quiet place. In front of the hotel you have one of the nicest little passages leading to the main street, called Hazzopulo. It is also quite close to St Anthony's church, and you can take the tram to either side of the street (Taksin square or Galata Tower). I would definitely come back to this hotel if we are back to Istanbul. It should be way up in TA's list!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: erdati
Reviews.Content: We got there easily from the airport, with the HAVAS bus - the station is 30 seconds walking from the hotel (it's not the case when you're leaving - the station is too far away). the room was great (610 - as for it. some other rooms, that we were offered prior to it, were too small). Spacious, good view of Istanbul, great shower etc) 4 days of great service, smiling and helpful men in the reception desk, supervised by the nice manager. The location is great, near Istiklal pedestrian street, and Taxim square, but without the noise. breakfast was good as well. Cannot think of any negative side, as a matter of fact. Taxi back to airport, with the driver of the hotel, costed 40 Turkish Lira. Bus was of course way cheaper. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: rustler16
Reviews.Content: The hotel's in a really well situated area, close to loads of restaurants, cafes and shops. The rooms are comfy and clean with very helpful staff. The hotel is a little off the beaten path and not all taxi drivers know exactly where it is. I'd suggest printing a map (with address) and keeping it with you to help the taxi drivers out a bit. A little irritating "tidbit" - the fridge turns off when you remove the keycard from the slot by the door. This meant we weren't able to keep our drinks cold. Breakfast is basic but does the job. If you're a light sleeper, and there over the weekend, there was music played late into the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: loopylou17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and loved the hotel's modern feel. The breakfast here is really good, the room this stay was a little on the small side with air-conditioning on quite a low setting. However hotel now has an excellent roof terrace with bar, which is good for catching some cool breezes and rehydrating! Spa facilities were good , tried out once, hot tub, pool and sauna - good when you return from a hot day seeing the sights. The people who work in the hotel are very helpful, cleaners were good and friendly, the location is set back away from the main street, but still conveniently close. So this means it is quieter but close to the action. Would definitely return for my third stay.....can't wait

Reviews.Title: “Good location, new and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nedim_g
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip for 4 days in Istanbul Turkey, and choose this hotel by internet. The room was ok, clean and not that small. Breakfast was ok but we expected to have a real turkish breakfast. The only thing is that we were in 5th floor and the wireless connection wasn"t wrking in our room. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Poor Staff and a lot of problems”
Reviews.Author: AugustoRucker
Reviews.Content: The structure of the hotel is good and the location of it is good. However, the staff of Miapera is very poor. First, we have book 2 double rooms and 1 twin room. Of course, the twin room was not provided (only in the second night, they provided us with twin room after discuss a lot with the manager). One of our rooms smell like waste-pipe. They gave us only one key for each room (no extra keys available), which means me and my partners should be together every time. They forgot to wake up us several times in a trip of 6 nights. They charged my credit card 670 euros with no reason and I had to lost my time with my bank manager to cancel the charge. The same happened with my mother, with the amount of 75 USD. In my point of view, do not stay at this hotel. It was the worst part of our trip. In general Turkish people are very very friendly if you know them better and the city is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good Istanbul location”
Reviews.Author: JonathanRB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central location but down a quiet side street which makes for a great location close to all the shopping and night life. It's very modern with luxury bathrooms and bedrooms although the bedroom was a little small. Very clean and friendly and if visiting Istanbul would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RJWal
Reviews.Content: The location of Mia Pera is very good, just a short stroll from Istiklal Caddesi (walking street) in the busy shopping and dining Beyoglu area, so perfect if this area is the place you choose to stay. The service was generally good although while we were there there seemed to be an overbooking issue and several guests did not a) receieve the room they had booked and paid for, or b) were accommodated at another hotel due to double booking. The hotel had an indoor pool and sauna for guest use which was quite a nice, calm place to relax. The rooftop terrace bar had wonderful views over the city - a pity about the loud music and TV dominating the space though. The furniture was also in need of a good clean - badly stained couches and chairs do not impress! Our room was comfortable and quite spacoius for an inner city hotel. The bathroom was stylish and well appointed. Breakfast was quite disappointing - the fresh fruit selection was poor compared to other hotels in Turkey and particularly so when there seemed to be abundant fruit growing in orchards and for sale at markets across the country. There was a poor selection across all the breakfast items and it gave me the impression of "cost-cutting". I didn't like the restaurant design - this is a very personal choice though. I found it to be cramped, noisy and some of the seating not ergonomically friendly. Good design should not only look good it should function well too! I had expected great things from Mia Pera but it didn't live up to my expectations

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CTRaceR
Reviews.Content: Great location. Spacious Room. Excellent Bathroom. Brilliant Breakfast. Everything you could ask for and certainly the nicest hotel in its class that we saw in this area. Negatives are, The staff were helpfull when asked but the service probably needs to the most improvement compared to other aspects of this hotel. We had a corner room and the WIFI service was unacceptable. My Sister had a central room on the same floor where the service was perfect. While the location is good in terms of restuarants, shops , nightlife and its proximity to Istiklal Street, It is located in a narrow back street and in 5 days we struggled to find a taxi driver that knew the hotel or the street "Mesrutiyet Caddesi" which coupled with their limited knowledge of english and ours of turkish made for some interesting taxi rides.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Newer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HHI_Mike
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location and were pleasantly surprised at how centrally located it is to shopping/dining/etc. It is one block from Itiskal Caddesi (almost the midpoint of this lively street!) and within minutes you are in the center of cosmopolitan Istanbul. The hotel rooms are small, but well appointed. The highlight is the bathroom, especially the shower -- whose rainhead produces more pressure than a car wash. The overall ambiance of the hotel is great and the service is decent. I do agree with other reviewers that the staff really does not go out of its way to make you feel at home, but when you interact with them they are friendly (reactive service vs. proactive service). Breakfast was good with a variety of choices -- overall, I would recommend it as a well priced hotel with a superior location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayflower28
Reviews.Content: Had a 2-night stopover in Istanbul and stayed at Mia Pera to be close to shopping/eating/nightlife. The location is great - very close to the main pedestrian boulevard, but just far enough away that it isn't noisy. The rooms had everything I needed, and the size was perfectly fine. The shower was a treat, and the beds comfortable. Only a few rooms per floor, so it was pretty quiet. The breakfast buffet is great, with a good selection of hot and cold food. The staff were relatively friendly, but didn't seem to feel the need to go out of their way to make you feel at home. With a lot of large groups, and possibly business travellers, it wasn't the kind of hotel where you could easily meet people, but that said, it wasn't unfriendly. I didn't spend any time at the hotel restaurant/bar. Spa services are available but they seemed overly pricy to me. The pool and sauna was nice, despite the ridiculously small change/shower area (would be better to change in your room). The gym (treadmill/bike and some weights) was small but useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel! Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Scottraveller6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in august 2010 with my boyfriend, got a taxi from the airport and driving through istanbul i was a little over whelmed, big change to what i am used to. Arrived at the hotel, quite small reception area but very nice and modern. Our room was not ready so we just waited but they didnt take long. We were given a room which was up a couple of floors but had french doors into a small decked garden, which was a bonus. Room was small but very clean, modern and nicely decorated. My only gripe is the air con- it is not the best but we managed and the location and hotel makes up for this. The breakfast is chaos, small dining area and the fact that staff are slow at clearing tables can cause some problems, but this is something the hotel is probably sort out soon, as the hotel is open longer. The hotel is a 2min walk to the main street in the taksim area. Very busy- like princes street in edinburgh or las ramblas in barcelona, plently of shops, restaurants and bars. Even at night this street is packed, it is a fantastic atmosphere. The hotel is also 2 min walk from the stalls and streets of bars and pubs, there was a great atmosphere, each pub was packed and people sitting outside. This hotel has been in the best location, for any hotel i have stayed in. My boyfriend and i often find when visiting cities that we often end up in a area where there is nothing to at night but this place is fantastic- honestly STAY HERE! Roof top bar is lovely too, very calming and relaxing after a night out in the hussle and bussle of istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving and insulting staff and ridicolous hotel policy”
Reviews.Author: wensmeeuw
Reviews.Content: With a group of 8 people we booked 4 rooms in the Miapera hotel to enjoy a long weekend in Istanbul. When we arrived, the staff told us that we had to move to another hotel because of water problems in our rooms. We had no alternative because this weekend in Istanbul every hotel in this area was fully booked, and rates for similar hotels were in the range of 500-1000 euro a room. We got very suspicious because we had already read the bad review by AscherDubai on Aug 16 2010 with a similar story. We booked the hotel very early for a rate of 129 euro a room, so we had the feeling that our 4 rooms were possibly given to other travelers for a much higher rate. Before moving, we told them we first would like to see the rooms with water problems. They showed us just one small room with some fake tools on the floor, a folded carpet and some plastic on the bed. Because everything was clean and dry, and there were no signs of water problems anywhere, we asked them to show our other 3 rooms. They told us they couldnâ€™t show us these rooms, and gave the ridiculous reason that they were not allowed by their Technical Manager. We asked for this Technical Manager, but he was (of course) not around for that day. Although we persisted to just open the doors of the other 3 rooms, they didnâ€™t want to do this. For us, the only thing we could do at that moment was to go to the other hotel they had arranged. This hotel, the Taslik hotel, was a very cheap hotel located in Besiktas. This meant we slept badly in very hot rooms, and we had to take a lot of long taxi-rides through all the traffic jams of Istanbul to arrive at our already booked restaurants and tours in the neighbourhood of the Miapera. The next morning, we took a taxi again from the Taslik to the Miapera, and they told us the could show us other rooms with water problems. These rooms look similarly ridiculous as the first one, with some random tools on the floor, a folded carped, and a opened A/C, an no signs of water or damp anywere. A fake situation you could arrange in 5 minutes in every random room, so it was clear these were arranged rooms of people already checked out in the morning. Of course we asked for a discount, because of the huge downgrade where received in moving to the Taslik hotel instead of the Miapera hotel. The gave us a discount of just 10% of the price, although the rate of the Taslik hotel is more than 30% lower than the Miapera hotel. This made us angry, but didnâ€™t surpise us: it was completely in consensus with our experience with the Miapera.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in brilliant location - just a few little bits to iron out”
Reviews.Author: Oz2_10
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this hotel although before booking we thought it was exorbitantly expensive, although the location is so perfect and the hotel was really lovely so we didn't regret it. We did stay over the weekend that ramadan finished so I imagine it was more expensive beacuse of this and there was also a raging party on the rooftop for these nights although thankfully that stopped for the rest of our week stay. The room was great and the spa downstairs was excellent - had a beautiful massage then they presented me with a cake for my birthday which was an appreciated extra touch. The hotel is literally two minutes from Istikal Caddesi - the main street of Beyoglu and it was a brilliant spot to stroll anytime of day or night to take in the culture of Istanbul. Beyoglu was a great area to stay in as we were not surrounded by tourists but swarms of all types of people and within easy walking distance to great restaurants and pubs. I was relieved we weren't staying in Sultanhemet after being there sightseeing it was nice to escape somewhere with a more lively vibe. Room service was amazing - I have never written that sentence before but truly the food at the hotel including breakfast was faultless. I encourage you to eat there! There a few little things that could be improved. Most of the staff were great, most especially Yo-kan and Firat, but there were one or two breakfast staff that were a little surly - maybe because they could do with putting one or two more staff on during breakfast. Also we had a couple of issues with our room key there and if you had the right person things were dealt with very smoothly but if not, problems were left unsolved. Yo-kan was so kind he even accompanied us to the post office to ensure we could safely post home some grand bazaar purchases. Overall we loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NUBGOD
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Istanbul with my girlfriend...we stayed here for 3 nights and it was just about perfect. The hotel is tucked nicely in what is a quite street not to far from Taksim Sqaure...Taxis to all the attractions (Blue Mosque etc...) is not too expensive and if you want to you can also easily walk down to use public transport... My only qualms i have about the hotel is that when we were there the Jacuzzi didn't have hot water! Also the staff insited that we use the hotels laundry service to iron 1 shirt...but the agreed to do this for free after we protested... Other than that everything was great! Recommend this hotel if you like stylish hotels...

Reviews.Title: “very nice, new and clean hotel near Istiklal and Pera”
Reviews.Author: Thefall
Reviews.Content: + new building, clean and very nice from the outside + large rooms, spotlessly clean and modern bathroom, the best AC system I've seen ever. Book directly with the hotel and ask for a room with balcony (204, 206 or 208) - the balcony turned out to be a huge terrace overlooking the garden of neighbouring British Embassy. Nice views and total silence at night, which is very good for this busy and crowded city. VERY nice room value for the price paid (99 EUR). + maid was never too early or too late, always very attentive. Room was always clean. + staff was willing to help, although their english must be improved. +\- free pool and sauna were too crowded to enjoy, but this was expected. Nothing good comes free of charge. +\- breakfast was tolerable, but nothing special. Restaurant was sometimes too crowded, and this could be improved. Why not use their roof lounge as a breakfast room? Definitely a very good choice in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: amephia
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband for our wedding anniversary. Location, staff, rooms, restaurant is excellent, I can recommend to everybody who wants to be in the middle of Istanbul. But if you are looking for sea-view from your room, I dont think this is the hotel you are looking. Except that, this hotel has everything you want. Definitely recommended. I want to stay there again, but prices got higher.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of beautiful Beyoglu”
Reviews.Author: tardigrades
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul for a short stay with my partner. Having heard that Beyoglu was a great place for eating and shopping, we thought we'd look for somewhere central in this area. The Mia Pera and the area didn't disappoint. The hotel is located less than a minute's walk to Istiklal Caddesi, the centre of eating, drinking and shopping in Istanbul. It is also about 10 minutes walk to Taksim Square, a central area for public transportation (it is a 20 minute or so ride to the main attractions in Sultanahmet). You can also take a tram down the centre of Istiklal Caddesi, which is convenient when you buy too many clothes or fill up on too many sweets! Even better than Istiklal is the myriad little bars and restaurants in the back streets of Beyoglu, which are open well into the night, especially on the weekend, so it is easy to grab a drink or something to eat at any time of day or night. Despite this, the hotel itself is very quiet (or so we thought) and we had no difficulties sleeping. The rooms are lovely - the bed was so comfortable - and have great air conditioning. The staff are really sweet and helpful, and were considerate enough to let us check in very early after my partner had gotten off a long flight. There is also a really nice (small) pool, spa and sauna. I could rave for pages about how much I enjoyed both this hotel and my stay in Istanbul. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and will be back as soon as I can!

HotelInfo.Name: Miapera Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kamer Hatun mah Mesrutiyet Caddesi No:34 | Beyoglu, Istanbul 34435, Turkey
